definition: fixed framework (idiom); restriction of social conventions and taboos (usually derogatory)/regulations and restrictions
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)
frame (e.g. door frame)/casing/fig. framework/template/to circle (i.e. draw a circle around sth)/to frame/to restrict/Taiwan pr. [kuang1]
frame (e.g. door frame)/casing/fig. framework/template/to circle (i.e. draw a circle around sth)/to frame/to restrict/Taiwan pr. [kuang1]

sentences.english: They opposed the creation of a lot of restrictions to tie the hands of the masses.
sentences.chinese: 他们反对定出许多条条框框来捆住群众的手脚。

sentences.english: There aren’t as many rules and restrictions.
sentences.chinese: 这里没有太多的条条框框和限制。

sentences.english: I’m not filling the board with check boxes.
sentences.chinese: 我不会用些条条框框来筛选人填充董事会。

sentences.english: Bureaucracy spawns many rules that complicate our life.
sentences.chinese: 官僚主义产生了使生活化的条条框框。

sentences.english: He revolted against the principles and norms of his time, he died young and he was a libertine," co-producer Albert Cohen said.
sentences.chinese: 他反抗当时的条条框框，还是个英年早逝的浪子。

definition: to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
lit. compass and set square/fig. established standard/rule/customs/practices/fig. upright and honest/well-behaved
to rebel against orthodoxy/to depart from established practices
